recipes.name: Italian Meatballs with Tomato Sauce
recipes.description: Traditional Italian meatballs cooked in rich tomato sauce. A staple at the Soprano family table, these tender meatballs are simmered in homemade sauce for authentic Italian flavor.
instructions: Make the tomato sauce according to the tomato sauce recipe.
Place all ingredients except oil in a large bowl. Mix well.
Rinse your hands in cold water and form meatballs no larger than small grapes.
Heat oil in a frying pan. Brown the meatballs well all around. (They will finish cooking in the tomato sauce later.)
When the tomato sauce has simmered for one and a half hours, add the meatballs and let them simmer for another half hour.
Serve with pasta.

recipes.name: Tomato Sauce
recipes.description: The foundation of Italian cooking - a rich, slow-simmered tomato sauce that's been passed down through generations of Italian families. Perfect for pasta, meatballs, and baked dishes.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper (about 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper)
10 fresh basil leaves, torn into strips
instructions: Heat oil over medium heat in a large thick-bottomed pot.
Add garlic and fry until golden. Stir in tomato paste and cook for one minute.
Process tomatoes smooth in a food processor and add to the pot.
Add red wine, basil, salt and pepper to taste.
Bring sauce to a boil, then let it simmer on low heat for 2 hours. Stir occasionally. Add water or more wine if the sauce becomes too thick.

recipes.name: Ziti al Forno
recipes.description: The famous baked ziti with meatballs - the ultimate Italian-American comfort food. This rich, layered pasta dish is a showstopper at family gatherings and Sunday dinners. Requires about 2 hours preparation plus over 1 hour baking time.
instructions: Make the tomato sauce according to the tomato sauce recipe.

Make the meatballs according to the meatball recipe. However, after the sauce has cooked for 1.5 hours, remove 7.5 dl of tomato sauce and pour into another pot. Add the meatballs to this pot and cook for another half hour.
Boil at least 4 liters of water in a large pot. Add pasta and salt to taste. Cook pasta al dente, so it still has some bite. Stir occasionally.
Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Drain pasta water and place pasta in the pot with the meatballs from step 2. Mix in half of the Parmesan cheese. Now the pasta, meatballs, some tomato sauce and half the Parmesan are in one pot.
Place half of the pasta with meatballs in a large (3-4 liter) ovenproof dish.
Sprinkle all the ricotta, mozzarella and half of the remaining Parmesan over it. Pour on 2.5 dl sauce.
Add the rest of the pasta and another 2.5 dl sauce. Sprinkle with the rest of the Parmesan.
Cover the dish with foil. (The dish can be prepared to this point and stored in the refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Remove about 30 minutes before cooking.)
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for another 15-30 minutes, or until sauce bubbles along the edges. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes before serving.
